CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 30, 1961, pg. 2 reads: "Resents Sentence - Traffic Patrolman William A. (Pat) Hillebrecht, who is well known throughout the Hill District, this week was enraged over what he termed a "light sentence" given to a child molester whom he arrested after a difficult time. "If the child had been white, there would have been a big difference," he said. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Police officer Pat Hillebrecht wearing badge no. 154, standing beside police car T-10 on residential street with church in background
